title: CVE-2020-3187 - unauthenticated arbitrary file deletion in Cisco

profile.name: QIWI
profile.about: The QIWI brand is a family brand that consolidates several directions: kiosks, wallet, bank.

vulnerability_information:
Steps to reproduce:
 I could delete arbitrary files from https://79.142.21.220/ using CVE-2020-3187.

POC video is attached.

Browser/OS: Chrome/Windows

ALSO Cisco ASA - Arbitary File Read - CVE-2020-3452

the file downloaded also attached here for poc

## Impact

Impact: RCE is P1 critical vulnerability, which can be used to make any server non functional causing millions of dollars loss.

Hello, @lalit2020.
There are several points why this issue was eligible with this amount:

1. The real impact of these issues is really very small:
```
An exploit could allow the attacker to view or delete arbitrary files on the targeted system. When the device is reloaded after exploitation of this vulnerability, any files that were deleted are restored.
```
as written in Cisco CVE
```
The attacker can only view and delete files within the web services file system. 
``` 
and 
```
This vulnerability cannot be used to obtain access to ASA or FTD system files or underlying operating system (OS) files.
```  
So it mean that attacker can not see the Cisco config with credentials or user data.

2. Current server refers to part of business that will be disabled in the nearest weeks. 

3. For second CVE
```
this could allow an attacker to impersonate another VPN user and establish a Clientless SSL VPN or AnyConnect VPN session to the device as that user.
```
So attacker could have own access to this VPN and There is no client traffic left there because of point #2

hi @venkyver

please clarify me only one things that every company in the world considered this CVE as P1 or P2 that means they are technically so week
for example dell,mastercard,atlassian,even small company also,but like Qiwi as a big company how they are given answer in a non technical way,i can also give many prrof from twitter that this CVE is accepted as p1 and p2

CVE2020-3187
A vulnerability in the web services interface of Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct directory traversal attacks and obtain read and delete access to sensitive files on a targeted system. The vulnerability is due to a lack of proper input validation of the HTTP URL. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request containing directory traversal character sequences. An exploit could allow the attacker to view or delete arbitrary files on the targeted system. When the device is reloaded after exploitation of this vulnerability, any files that were deleted are restored. The attacker can only view and delete files within the web services file system. This file system is enabled when the affected device is configured with either WebVPN or AnyConnect features. This vulnerability can not be used to obtain access to ASA or FTD system files or underlying operating system (OS) files. Reloading the affected device will restore all files within the web services file system.

It just so happens that everything is dependent on the circumstances: companies you name may find themselves in circumstances different to ours and thus consider both CVEs as having even higher impact than stated by cisco.

Since no client traffic is present and the server is being shut down in the nearest future we do not and can not consider these issues (generally seen as high or critical) having that significant impact on our infrastructure.

hi @gmedian

You are absolutely Right, and let's look closer why:

Imagine that you have thousands of users on this server, which they are using as a main VPN Gateway in company (because of remote work in 2020). In this case - breaking the server will be absolutely harmful for company, because users won't be able to work. No work - no money. And in that case I would say - It's Blocker situation with CVSS 10, maximum impact and I pay you maximum bounty.

But in our situation, we have no users on this server at all. Also this server will be uninstalled in few weeks.
And if you break this server then it wont have any impact for us. Because no one is using this server.

But in our situation, we have no users on this server at all. Also this server will be uninstalled in few weeks.
And if you break this server then it wont have any impact for us. Because no one is using this server.

The decision is final because bounty is not paid for the maximum __potential__ impact in general, nor it is paid based on the payments made by other companies, but for the actual impact on the particular infrastructure. And that is the rule for all companies across hackerone platform: both huge and small alike.

We have already explained our reasoning for lowering the severity and therefore the bounty, so we ask you to accept our judgement.

14 days to fix critical issue is a very long time. 
In case of critical issues we are closing problem in 1-2 days. Current problem is not so important for us so that's why we slowly resolved it and then marked it as Medium severity.

Also, you can look into history of our program, where you will see that we gladly pay for a good bugs, that really harmful for our system. We are honest with researchers.
